intro: Diasperus racemiger, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinctive reddish or purple coloration. Diasperus racemiger is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
